subject: p16059470
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. The patient is status post median sternotomy and CABG. Left-sided AICD is unchanged in position. Patchy right lower lobe opacity is seen, worrisome for consolidation which could be due to infection or aspiration. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen. The cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are stable with the cardiac silhouette top normal.
Impression: Patchy right lower lobe opacity is seen, worrisome for consolidation which could be due to infection or aspiration.
